etymologies: Old English sceanca, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch schenk ‘leg bone’ and German Schenkel ‘thigh’. The use of the verb as a golfing term dates from the 1920s

definitions: a person's leg, especially the part from the knee to the ankle

examples.text: the old man's thin, bony shanks showed through his trousers

definitions: the lower part of an animal's foreleg

examples.text: many fast animals have long shanks or calves

definitions: the lower part of an animal's foreleg as a cut of meat

examples.text: meals like ham hocks and lamb shanks are cooked with reasonably priced cuts of meat

shortDefinitions: this part of animal's leg as cut of meat

definitions: a long, narrow part of a tool connecting the handle to the operational end

examples.text: gouges vary in the amount of curve or sweep on the cutting edge and the form of the shank

shortDefinitions: long, narrow part of tool connecting handle to operational end

definitions: the cylindrical part of a bit by which it is held in a drill.
shortDefinitions: cylindrical part of bit by which it is held in drill

definitions: the long stem of a key, spoon, anchor, etc.

examples.text: all Roman lever keys have a tubular shank

shortDefinitions: long stem of key, spoon, anchor

definitions: the straight part of a nail or fishhook.
a part or appendage by which something is attached to something else, especially a wire loop attached to the back of a button.
shortDefinitions: part or appendage by which something is attached to something else

definitions: the band of a ring rather than the setting or gemstone.
shortDefinitions: band of ring rather than setting or gemstone

definitions: the narrow middle of the sole of a shoe

examples.text: a rigid leather boot with a full shank

shortDefinitions: narrow middle of sole of shoe

definitions: a makeshift knife fashioned from a sharp item such as broken glass or a razor

examples.text: he used a shank to threaten a guard and steal his uniform

definitions: an act of striking the ball with the heel of the club

examples.text: he hit a shank with his tee shot and took double bogey

shortDefinitions: act of striking ball with heel of club

definitions: a mishit shot, typically one that is struck with the frame of the racket

examples.text: one of the worst shots the great man has ever played—a forehand shank from on top of the net

definitions: strike (the ball) with the heel of the club

examples.text: I shanked a shot and hit a person on a shoulder

shortDefinitions: strike ball with heel of club

definitions: mishit (a shot), typically by striking it with the frame of the racket

examples.text: he missed an easy smash then shanked a backhand volley

definitions: slash or stab (someone), especially with a makeshift knife

examples.text: I got shanked with a broken bottle
my friend pulled a knife and shanked him
